name: places/ChIJg3v1VcBYwokRIZMRJx8lyIM

displayName.text: Consulate General of the Czech Republic

formattedAddress: 321 E 73rd St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 321 E 73rd St, New York, NY 10021-3705, USA

originalText.text: Terribly rude staff, on email, telephone, and especially in person. I needed to complete a simple procedure to have the consulate issue a certificate saying that I do not have a criminal record in the Czech Republic. I was given different answers from different people about the procedure, and then told I was at fault for not following protocols after I was told contradictory information by different employees. Finally, when I drove 2 hours to the consulate and paid upwards of 50$ to park in a garage, I was refused service, and my mother, who is a senior citizen, and I were treated as if we were below second-class citizens. The whole process of dealing with this consulate was demeaning and excessively bureaucratic, and such a misrepresentation of the wonderful country and people it is supposed to represent.

originalText.text:
They don’t even pick up the phone
I’m trying to months to contact them,
And Email coming back ,
I guess Coffee is more important

originalText.text: Excellent, fast and highly professional service. Every time I’ve scheduled an appointment, I have moved forward with any documentation seamlessly. Thank you to ALL the staff from the front desk to their offices, especially to Mrs./Ms. Veselá And to Mrs. Vintrová. They are precise with each and every document, they are caring and highly knowledgeable.

originalText.text: Shame on Czech Consulate and government. They don’t distinguish among people who really need help and assistance. Just blatant denial. Looks like they’re engaged in discrimination based on citizenship. Such a shame and total disappointment. Not to mention they do not answer emails and phone calls

originalText.text: Great experience with Mr. Olsa. We had an appointment and he was very helpful, efficient and accommodating. Very appreciative!
